subject: Re: [junit] What's going on with TestSuite?
msgSnippet: ... Then why is it behaving like this? ... I am--the problem is the TestCollector won t even load the class if there is no test methods in the class! The
messageBody:
Vladimir Bossicard wrote:
>
> > I am trying to get a TestSuite to add tests to itself, and it is not
> > working. It is requiring at least one dummy "test" method. That sucks.
>
> Every TestCase (and not TestSuite) must have at least one method starting with "test".

Then why is it behaving like this?

> > How do I have a collected TestSuite that executes as a TestSuite and
> > not as a TestCase?
>
> use the addTest method. In my 'AllTests.java' :
>
> public static Test suite () {
> TestSuite suite = new TestSuite("JUnit tests");
>
> TestSuite framework = new TestSuite("JUnit framework");
> framework.addTestSuite(junit.framework.AssertionFailedErrorTest.class);
> framework.addTestSuite(junit.framework.TestResultTest.class);
> framework.addTestSuite(junit.framework.TestRegistryTest.class);
> suite.addTest(framework);
>
> return suite;
> }

I am--the problem is the TestCollector won't even load the class if there
is no "test" methods in the class!


The UGLY HACK is to have one (1) method named "testTest" that does nothing.
The constructor does the rest.
